results.title: Metformin enhances the immunomodulatory potential of adipose-derived mesenchymal stem cells through STAT1 in an animal model of lupus.
results.text_hl: Administration of @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@-treated Ad-MSCs resulted in significant disease activity improvement including @DISEASE_Inflammation @DISEASE_MESH:D007249 @@@inflammatory@@@ phenotype, @<m>DISEASE_Glomerulonephritis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D005921 @@@glomerulonephritis@@@, @DISEASE_Proteinuria @DISEASE_MESH:D011507 @@@proteinuria@@@ and anti-dsDNA IgG antibody production in @CELLLINE_CVCL:B6HA @@@MRL/lpr@@@ @SPECIES_10090 @@@mice@@@.

citations.NLM: Jang SG, Lee J, Hong SM, Kwok SK, Cho ML, Park SH. Metformin enhances the immunomodulatory potential of adipose-derived mesenchymal stem cells through STAT1 in an animal model of lupus. Rheumatology (Oxford). 2020 Jun 1;59(6):1426-1438. PMID: 31904843

results.title: Effect of metformin treatment on glucose tolerance and glomerulosclerosis in KK mice.
